meanings.definition: A device used for crushing or squeezing
meanings.sent1: The ecraseurs in the factory efficiently crush cans for recycling.
meanings.sent2: She used the ecraseurs to squeeze the juice out of the oranges.
meanings.sent3: The ecraseurs at the carnival booth were so strong, they turned a watermelon into juice in seconds!
meanings.sent4: His hands were like ecraseurs, crushing the opponent's hopes of winning.
meanings.sent5: The giant ecraseurs in the movie flattened entire buildings with ease.

meanings.definition: A person who crushes or squeezes
meanings.sent1: The wrestler was known as the ecraseurs in the ring for his powerful grip.
meanings.sent2: The ecraseurs at the fruit market carefully selected the ripest tomatoes.
meanings.sent3: The ecraseurs at the lemonade stand playfully squeezed the lemons to make refreshing drinks.
meanings.sent4: She was an emotional ecraseurs, always crushing his feelings with her harsh words.
meanings.sent5: The ecraseurs in the bakery expertly kneaded the dough to perfection.

meanings.definition: The act of crushing or squeezing
meanings.sent1: The loud noise in the kitchen was the ecraseurs of garlic being crushed.
meanings.sent2: The ecraseurs of the heavy machinery echoed through the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The ecraseurs of the kids playing with clay could be heard from the next room.
meanings.sent4: The ecraseurs of the waves against the rocks created a calming rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The ecraseurs of the car tires on the gravel driveway signaled his arrival.
